The potential implications of all humans becoming vegetarians include increased food security and reduced deforestation.
The possible consequences of all humans becoming vegetarians include difficulty producing certain types of food and food shortages.
The results of all humans becoming vegetarians include changes in society and the environment.
The positive aspects of all humans becoming vegetarians include better health outcomes, more sustainable lifestyles, and changes in consumer habits.
The potential drawbacks of all humans becoming vegetarian include the difficulties of living life without animal products and the potential adverse effects on the environment.
